name: B. Timofey and cubes
statement:
Young Timofey has a birthday today! He got kit of cubes as a birthday
present from his parents. Every cube has a number , which is written on
it. Timofey put all the cubes in a row and went to unpack other
presents.In this time, Timofey’s elder brother, Dima reordered the cubes
using the following rule. Suppose the cubes are numbered from to in
their order. Dima performs several steps, on step he reverses the
segment of cubes from -th to -th. He does this while .After performing
the operations Dima went away, being very proud of himself. When Timofey
returned to his cubes, he understood that their order was changed. Help
Timofey as fast as you can and save the holiday restore the initial
order of the cubes using information of their current location.
editorial:
operations are reversible. If we apply them to the
current order, we will get the initial. Also note that all the elements
on even positions will remain on their places. Such numbers are affected
an even number of times, so nothing will change. Similarly all elements
on odd positions will change places with simmetrial ones relatively the
centre. So, we change elements on odd places with their pairs. This
works for time.Authorâs solution: http://pastebin.com/X8R0i9vM
